      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean canFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.

      • canFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean canFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                           org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                           int timeout)
        Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found. You can manually set the timeout (in seconds) given that it will be multiplied by 4.
        Parameters:
        driver -
        elementLocator -
        Returns:

      • internalCanFindUniqueElement

        public static boolean internalCanFindUniqueElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                                   org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
        For internal use ONLY inside the ElementActions library, Custom Validations package, and the Screenshooter class. Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.
        Parameters:
        driver -
        elementLocator -
        Returns:

                                                   org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                                   int timeout)
        For internal use ONLY inside the Custom Validations package (AssertElementExists(false). Returns True if only one element matches the locator specified, and Returns false (with a descriptive error) if no elements were found, or if more than one element was found.
